article: A family owned a farm near Beulah, Michigan U.S. They kept a bull chained to an old elm tree. The bull walked around the tree, _ a heavy iron chain with him, which cut a trench on the surface of the tree about three feet off ground. The trench _ over the years, though for whatever _ , it didn't kill the tree. Later, the family sold the _ and took their bull to their new home in another state. They cut the chain, _ the iron ring behind around the tree. Over the years, bark _ covered the rusting chain. Then one year, an agricultural disaster _ Michigan. All of the elms lining the road leading to the farm became _ with the disease and died. Everyone figured that the old, badly wounded elm could hardly _ . The farm's owners even considered cutting down the tree _ it died. But they simply _ to do so. It was as if the old tree had become a family friend. So they decided to leave it as it was.  _ , the tree didn't die! Year after year it grew well . Nobody could understand why it was the only elm still standing there. _ experts came over to study the tree. They observed the trench left by the iron chain, now almost completely covered by bark and badly corroded . The experts _ that it was the rusting chain that saved the elm's life. They _ that the tree must have absorbed so much iron from the rusting chain that it became _ to the disease. It is said that what doesn't kill you will make you _ . Or, as Ernest Hemingway put it, "Life _ us all, but afterwards, many of us are strongest at the broken places."
